title: 108_s806
content: The Act titled "Deployed Service Members Financial Security and Education Act of 2003" provides additional allowances for lengthy or numerous deployments and frequent mobilizations. The "Deployed Service Members Financial Security and Education Act of 2003" introduces a new section in Chapter 7 of title 37, United States Code, providing a monthly allowance for members of the armed forces for lengthy or numerous deployments and frequent mobilizations. The allowance is paid for each month of deployment meeting specific criteria. The "Deployed Service Members Financial Security and Education Act of 2003" introduces a new section in Chapter 7 of title 37, United States Code, providing a monthly allowance of $1,000 for members of the armed forces who have served 401 days or more out of the preceding 730 days on active duty. Claims for the allowance must be substantiated by the member's recordkeeping system. The recordkeeping system for members under section 991(c) of title 10 must be paid if the member provides sufficient evidence to substantiate the claim. The monthly allowance under this section is additional to other allowances and pay. The definition of "deployed" in this section refers to deployment as defined in section 991(b) of title 10. Section 437 of title 37, United States Code, provides an additional allowance for lengthy or numerous deployments and frequent mobilizations. It will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act and apply to periods of deployment or active duty before, on, or after such date. No allowance may be paid for months before the enactment of this Act. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act of 1940 is amended to include the applicability of interest rate limitations to student loans, including those under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Additionally, the Act is amended to preserve educational status and tuition for service members. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act of 1940 is amended to include provisions for military service members enrolled in higher education to be granted a leave of absence and entitled to have their educational status restored without loss of credits, scholarships, or fees. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act of 1940 is amended to allow military service members in higher education to take a leave of absence without losing credits, scholarships, or fees. Fees can be credited to the next enrollment period or refunded based on the percentage of completed enrollment. The Soldiers' and Sailors' Civil Relief Act of 1940 is amended to allow military service members in higher education to take a leave of absence without losing credits, scholarships, or fees. Withdrawal percentages are specified based on the completion of the enrollment period.
